// Elsie's Rifle (god-pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks first choice "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this is an absolute monster of a weapon. Elsie’s can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio." Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=839105230,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=1467527085,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692


// Elsie's Rifle (god-pvp) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks first choice "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this is an absolute monster of a weapon. Elsie’s can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=1467527085,1885400500,2387244414,460017080


// Elsie's Rifle (pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this is an absolute monster of a weapon. Elsie’s can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio." Masterwork: Reload, Handling tags:pve

// Elsie's Rifle (pvp) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this is an absolute monster of a weapon. Elsie’s can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio." Masterwork: Range tags:pvp

// Midnight Coup () (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload 
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3038247973,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3038247973,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,4104185692


// Midnight Coup () (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload

// Luna's Howl (god-pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks first choice "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123


// Luna's Howl (god-pvp) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Perks first choice "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=3250034553,1885400500,3017780555,2720533289


// Luna's Howl (pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Reload tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123

// Luna's Howl (pvp) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Perks "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Range, Handling tags:pvp

// Succession (god-pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks first choice "Oof. From the top to the bottom of these new weapons. There is actually no reason to get this gun at all. The raid version is strictly better in every way as this brings no better or more interesting perk pairings, and the Bray Inheritance origin trait is just a better version of Indomitability. The only thing that could be said here is that Discord is at least something different in perk slot 1, but you’d have to eschew Reconstruction for that, and ultimately what would be the point? I get that it prints free ammo, but why are you using an aggressive sniper rifle for add clear? This weapon makes no sense to reissue and should be the only hard avoid on the list. #12 and it isn’t close. " Masterwork: Handling tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=570866107&perks=1840239774,106909392,1523832109,469285294


// Succession (pve) (Holofoil)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks "Oof. From the top to the bottom of these new weapons. There is actually no reason to get this gun at all. The raid version is strictly better in every way as this brings no better or more interesting perk pairings, and the Bray Inheritance origin trait is just a better version of Indomitability. The only thing that could be said here is that Discord is at least something different in perk slot 1, but you’d have to eschew Reconstruction for that, and ultimately what would be the point? I get that it prints free ammo, but why are you using an aggressive sniper rifle for add clear? This weapon makes no sense to reissue and should be the only hard avoid on the list. #12 and it isn’t close. " Masterwork: Handling tags:pve

title:S23 Prophecy Random Roll Weapons
description:The Origin trait here is called Crossing Over, and it is mostly forgettable. Its effect is negligible PvE and is a decent passive benefit in PvP, but nothing that pushes these weapons over the top on its own.

// Darkest Before (pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks "Best in class stats across the board, but there are many reasons why this weapon is way behind most other primaries you could choose. Unfortunately this pulse has deterministic recoil which is extremely unfortunate on one of the most punishing archetypes in the entire game for recoil direction. Also, the way the sandbox has shifted this weapon has the same optimal ttk as many auto rifles and actually gets outranged by most of them. For PvP this is likely a nonstarter, especially since you have to basically get a perfect roll in order to be competitive at base. For PvE this can get some fine rolls, but is unfortunately outclassed entirely by Adhortative and other solar pulses. Not being craftable also makes this pretty much pointless to farm." Masterwork: Reload tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=839105230,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123

// Darkest Before (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks "Best in class stats across the board, but there are many reasons why this weapon is way behind most other primaries you could choose. Unfortunately this pulse has deterministic recoil which is extremely unfortunate on one of the most punishing archetypes in the entire game for recoil direction. Also, the way the sandbox has shifted this weapon has the same optimal ttk as many auto rifles and actually gets outranged by most of them. For PvP this is likely a nonstarter, especially since you have to basically get a perfect roll in order to be competitive at base. For PvE this can get some fine rolls, but is unfortunately outclassed entirely by Adhortative and other solar pulses. Not being craftable also makes this pretty much pointless to farm." Masterwork: Range tags:pvp
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=839105230,1885400500,3017780555,460017080

dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=839105230,679225683,3017780555,1015611457


// Relentless (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks first choice "The stat package is among the worst in the archetype, with the notable exception of Aim Assist. The main draw of this weapon is if you are a High-Impact Pulse enjoyer and want to abuse Slice with Hunter dodge in PvP. Also Hatchling is weirdly strong on this particular archetype. Go max range and use the origin trait to make up for any small discrepancy. For the most part this is not better than other weapons in the same class, but it provides a different way to play." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=202670084,1885400500,923806249,460017080
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=202670084,1885400500,923806249,2387244414

// Relentless (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks "The stat package is among the worst in the archetype, with the notable exception of Aim Assist. The main draw of this weapon is if you are a High-Impact Pulse enjoyer and want to abuse Slice with Hunter dodge in PvP. Also Hatchling is weirdly strong on this particular archetype. Go max range and use the origin trait to make up for any small discrepancy. For the most part this is not better than other weapons in the same class, but it provides a different way to play." Masterwork: Range, Handling, Stability tags:pvp

// Adjudicator (god-pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks first choice "Highest range stat, but lowest zoom in class makes for an interesting weapon. The only weapon this really competes with is Unending Tempest, but the sandbox has been shifting away from these weapons for a while now - especially Target Lock. For PvP this weapon is pretty much just for the user’s feel. If the zoom feels good for you, go for it. Personally, I won’t be target farming this for PvP (sidearms > SMGs) or PvE (Multimach > Adjudicator), but I’ll keep whatever good rolls I get along the way." Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=1013434963&perks=1840239774,3230963543,4071163871,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=1013434963&perks=4090651448,3230963543,4071163871,3891536761

// Adjudicator (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Perks "Highest range stat, but lowest zoom in class makes for an interesting weapon. The only weapon this really competes with is Unending Tempest, but the sandbox has been shifting away from these weapons for a while now - especially Target Lock. For PvP this weapon is pretty much just for the user’s feel. If the zoom feels good for you, go for it. Personally, I won’t be target farming this for PvP (sidearms > SMGs) or PvE (Multimach > Adjudicator), but I’ll keep whatever good rolls I get along the way." Masterwork: Range, Handling tags:pvp

// Prosecutor (god-pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommend Rolls first choice "Competitive stats and a great PvP archetype currently. The sandbox is about to shift though, so I would not invest in this. Especially since other autos in this archetype are easier to get and superior in terms of stats. Zen Moment is likely to be one of the big losers of the global Flinch Resist buff, so I’d personally target Keep Away for perk 1. For PvE it can get a solid roll, but nothing that is so incredible that it is a mandatory farm." Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3619207468,2173046394


// Prosecutor (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommend Rolls first choice "Competitive stats and a great PvP archetype currently. The sandbox is about to shift though, so I would not invest in this. Especially since other autos in this archetype are easier to get and superior in terms of stats. Zen Moment is likely to be one of the big losers of the global Flinch Resist buff, so I’d personally target Keep Away for perk 1. For PvE it can get a solid roll, but nothing that is so incredible that it is a mandatory farm." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=3250034553,679225683,3619207468,2610012052


// Prosecutor (pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommend Rolls "Competitive stats and a great PvP archetype currently. The sandbox is about to shift though, so I would not invest in this. Especially since other autos in this archetype are easier to get and superior in terms of stats. Zen Moment is likely to be one of the big losers of the global Flinch Resist buff, so I’d personally target Keep Away for perk 1. For PvE it can get a solid roll, but nothing that is so incredible that it is a mandatory farm." Masterwork: Reload tags:pve

// Prosecutor (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommend Rolls "Competitive stats and a great PvP archetype currently. The sandbox is about to shift though, so I would not invest in this. Especially since other autos in this archetype are easier to get and superior in terms of stats. Zen Moment is likely to be one of the big losers of the global Flinch Resist buff, so I’d personally target Keep Away for perk 1. For PvE it can get a solid roll, but nothing that is so incredible that it is a mandatory farm." Masterwork: Range, Handling, Stability tags:pvp

// A Sudden Death (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks "Bad stats across the board and is immediately outclassed by weapons released 9 seasons ago. You need a really, really good roll to get this to a functional state and even then it is just straight up noncompetitive. There is no reason to use this in PvE with these perks." Masterwork: Range, Handling tags:pvp

title:S23 Mid-Season Random Roll Weapons
description:The Wild Card origin trait has a chance to drop a few orange telesto balls on the ground. It’s pretty cool, not sure how great it is in total, but hey, free damage and area control isn’t anything to sneeze at.

// Wild Style (Adept) ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "Horrible. Just a horrible, horrible weapon. Such a profound disappointment compared to the beast that is Wilderflight." Masterwork: Reload

// Tusk of the Boar ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "This is the actual best weapon we’re getting this midseason update. The stats on this are so high, including the Field-Tested origin trait (which will stack up quickly due to the nature of the weapon) that you don’t necessarily need Enlightened Action or to make up for missing stats in many places on the weapon. The base reload of the gun plus the origin trait means that you really won’t notice much of the effects of Enlightened Action if you happen to roll that saly. Slice is a nifty trick in perk 1 slot, and slideways is also good. But the real juice is Envious Assassin. At first it may seem like the perk is at odds with the nature of an add clear weapon, but all it takes is 1 kill to refill a round, so right off the bat at worst this perk is autoloading holster, and at best it can fill up to 3 shots in the mag. Deconstruct is where things really get interesting. This means the gun can reload itself out of thin air directly into the mag. It won’t have the AOE capability of Chain Reaction, but that is being nerfed with TFS. Hatchling is an option for warlock builds." Masterwork: Reload, Handling 
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,3993379141
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2039302152,3993379141
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2039302152,2396489472


// Tusk of the Boar ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "This is the actual best weapon we’re getting this midseason update. The stats on this are so high, including the Field-Tested origin trait (which will stack up quickly due to the nature of the weapon) that you don’t necessarily need Enlightened Action or to make up for missing stats in many places on the weapon. The base reload of the gun plus the origin trait means that you really won’t notice much of the effects of Enlightened Action if you happen to roll that saly. Slice is a nifty trick in perk 1 slot, and slideways is also good. But the real juice is Envious Assassin. At first it may seem like the perk is at odds with the nature of an add clear weapon, but all it takes is 1 kill to refill a round, so right off the bat at worst this perk is autoloading holster, and at best it can fill up to 3 shots in the mag. Deconstruct is where things really get interesting. This means the gun can reload itself out of thin air directly into the mag. It won’t have the AOE capability of Chain Reaction, but that is being nerfed with TFS. Hatchling is an option for warlock builds." Masterwork: Reload, Handling, Velocity

// The Summoner (Adept) (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks first choice "Massively overhyped and overperforming in the current sandbox due to the current artifact mod Flint Striker. And even with it overperforming it is still just middle of the pack. Heal Clip is the real strength of the weapon, as the perk has been overbuffed. The base recoil and stickiness of the spray is very nice as well, which makes stability not needed here. A perfectly fine weapon, but far from a meta destroyer, especially once Flint Striker is gone." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=1292594730&perks=3250034553,679225683,3017780555,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1292594730&perks=3250034553,1885400500,3017780555,95528736

// The Slammer (Adept) ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "One of the most interesting weapons released in a long time. Bait and Switch is absolute bait right now. Going for a DPS roll on this archetype is a trap as Vortex frames are hilariously terrible for damage currently (the heavy attack costs 6(!) ammo so you’re way better off spamming light attacks) and are so far behind normal adaptives, let alone Bequest, that is just isn’t worth pretending it is good right now. If you have the patience and the vault space it is probably worth keeping a Bait & Switch roll for any future buffs they give to vortex frames though. For general use, Cold Steel is really cool since it can CC mobs, but also stun both overload and unstoppable champions if you are brave enough (the Stunning Recovery origin trait will heal you once you proc the stun, but you have to survive long enough to get it!). Unlike most other swords you want to prioritize ammo over damage for an Eager Edge/Chain Reaction + Cold Steel/Demo roll." Masterwork: Impact 
dimwishlist:item=1354727549&perks=1261178282,269888150,2077819806,3650930298


// The Slammer (Adept) ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "One of the most interesting weapons released in a long time. Bait and Switch is absolute bait right now. Going for a DPS roll on this archetype is a trap as Vortex frames are hilariously terrible for damage currently (the heavy attack costs 6(!) ammo so you’re way better off spamming light attacks) and are so far behind normal adaptives, let alone Bequest, that is just isn’t worth pretending it is good right now. If you have the patience and the vault space it is probably worth keeping a Bait & Switch roll for any future buffs they give to vortex frames though. For general use, Cold Steel is really cool since it can CC mobs, but also stun both overload and unstoppable champions if you are brave enough (the Stunning Recovery origin trait will heal you once you proc the stun, but you have to survive long enough to get it!). Unlike most other swords you want to prioritize ammo over damage for an Eager Edge/Chain Reaction + Cold Steel/Demo roll." Masterwork: Impact

// The Summoner (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks first choice "Massively overhyped and overperforming in the current sandbox due to the current artifact mod Flint Striker. And even with it overperforming it is still just middle of the pack. Heal Clip is the real strength of the weapon, as the perk has been overbuffed. The base recoil and stickiness of the spray is very nice as well, which makes stability not needed here. A perfectly fine weapon, but far from a meta destroyer, especially once Flint Striker is gone." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=1820994983&perks=3250034553,679225683,3017780555,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1820994983&perks=3250034553,1885400500,3017780555,95528736


// The Summoner (pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Perks "Massively overhyped and overperforming in the current sandbox due to the current artifact mod Flint Striker. And even with it overperforming it is still just middle of the pack. Heal Clip is the real strength of the weapon, as the perk has been overbuffed. The base recoil and stickiness of the spray is very nice as well, which makes stability not needed here. A perfectly fine weapon, but far from a meta destroyer, especially once Flint Striker is gone." Masterwork: Range tags:pvp

There is one neat trick this gun can do as it can roll Discord+Cascade Point for some silly shenanigans. Otherwise you can go for a max reload+kill clip roll if you really like using this style of weapon." Masterwork: Stability tags:god-pvp

There is one neat trick this gun can do as it can roll Discord+Cascade Point for some silly shenanigans. Otherwise you can go for a max reload+kill clip roll if you really like using this style of weapon." Masterwork: Stability, Reload tags:pvp

// The Slammer ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "One of the most interesting weapons released in a long time. Bait and Switch is absolute bait right now. Going for a DPS roll on this archetype is a trap as Vortex frames are hilariously terrible for damage currently (the heavy attack costs 6(!) ammo so you’re way better off spamming light attacks) and are so far behind normal adaptives, let alone Bequest, that is just isn’t worth pretending it is good right now. If you have the patience and the vault space it is probably worth keeping a Bait & Switch roll for any future buffs they give to vortex frames though. For general use, Cold Steel is really cool since it can CC mobs, but also stun both overload and unstoppable champions if you are brave enough (the Stunning Recovery origin trait will heal you once you proc the stun, but you have to survive long enough to get it!). Unlike most other swords you want to prioritize ammo over damage for an Eager Edge/Chain Reaction + Cold Steel/Demo roll." Masterwork: Impact 
dimwishlist:item=2889501828&perks=1261178282,269888150,2077819806,3650930298


// The Slammer ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "One of the most interesting weapons released in a long time. Bait and Switch is absolute bait right now. Going for a DPS roll on this archetype is a trap as Vortex frames are hilariously terrible for damage currently (the heavy attack costs 6(!) ammo so you’re way better off spamming light attacks) and are so far behind normal adaptives, let alone Bequest, that is just isn’t worth pretending it is good right now. If you have the patience and the vault space it is probably worth keeping a Bait & Switch roll for any future buffs they give to vortex frames though. For general use, Cold Steel is really cool since it can CC mobs, but also stun both overload and unstoppable champions if you are brave enough (the Stunning Recovery origin trait will heal you once you proc the stun, but you have to survive long enough to get it!). Unlike most other swords you want to prioritize ammo over damage for an Eager Edge/Chain Reaction + Cold Steel/Demo roll." Masterwork: Impact

// Multimach CCX ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "This is one of the best weapons we’re getting in the mid-season update. The Field-Tested Origin Trait is fantastic on a fast-firing SMG like this, as well as the proc from Kinetic Tremors coming into play there. The biggest drawbacks are going to be Reload (without a proper Perk 1 since we’re going Attrition Orbs) and Range. You need to strike a balance between the two stats in order for this to really shine, and remember that it will be super easy to hit 1 or 2 stacks of Field-Tested almost immediately which provides meaningful bonuses to both of the stats we’re targeting. Attrition Orbs here makes this a unique weapon off the bat as an absurd orb battery, but you can go for Under-Over if you want a good option for the next time SMGs have Barrier-breaking capability from the artifact." Masterwork: Reload 
dimwishlist:item=3211624072&perks=3250034553,3230963543,243981275,3891536761


// Multimach CCX ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "This is one of the best weapons we’re getting in the mid-season update. The Field-Tested Origin Trait is fantastic on a fast-firing SMG like this, as well as the proc from Kinetic Tremors coming into play there. The biggest drawbacks are going to be Reload (without a proper Perk 1 since we’re going Attrition Orbs) and Range. You need to strike a balance between the two stats in order for this to really shine, and remember that it will be super easy to hit 1 or 2 stacks of Field-Tested almost immediately which provides meaningful bonuses to both of the stats we’re targeting. Attrition Orbs here makes this a unique weapon off the bat as an absurd orb battery, but you can go for Under-Over if you want a good option for the next time SMGs have Barrier-breaking capability from the artifact." Masterwork: Reload, Range

title:Guardian Games 2024 Weapons
description:The Origin trait for these weapons is Classy Contender, which gives you a bit of class ability energy. Meh.

// The Title ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "Oof. Just bottom of the barrel stats across the board, and nothing really to help it out.The gun itself is solidly mediocre, but there are several SMGs that do everything this does so much better. There is nothing about this gun that screams out to be chased.As it stands I can’t in good conscience recommend grinding for this weapon. You can get many completely decent rolls here if you don’t have other good options in lieu of this, but this is a profoundly middling weapon. Destabilizing Rounds is not good." Masterwork: Reload, Range, Handling

// Hullabaloo ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "This is incredibly exciting and new. The journey for Heavy Wave GLs has been quite something as when the first one launched with Lightfall it was just a creative way to blow yourself up. NOW they are becoming incredible for add clear, rivaling if not surpassing Machine Guns, and there is an upcoming 30% buff to chain reaction on Heavy Wave GLs in TFS that should make this absolutely unrivaled for massive add clear. Voltshot can roll in the perk 1 slot, but is not really very interesting as you can only improve reload on the masterwork which is a 1 out of 5 chance and only gets the gun to barely 50 reload. Even then the purpose of Voltshot is add clear, which the weapon is already incredible at, so there really isn’t any point in going for that. Blast Radius only affects the initial explosion before the wave goes out, so the value of that stat is overhyped on this weapon. Handling is really the true giga-stat for Hullabaloo when paired with Autoloader or Envious Assassin." Masterwork: Handling 
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3300816228,2396489472


// Hullabaloo ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "This is incredibly exciting and new. The journey for Heavy Wave GLs has been quite something as when the first one launched with Lightfall it was just a creative way to blow yourself up. NOW they are becoming incredible for add clear, rivaling if not surpassing Machine Guns, and there is an upcoming 30% buff to chain reaction on Heavy Wave GLs in TFS that should make this absolutely unrivaled for massive add clear. Voltshot can roll in the perk 1 slot, but is not really very interesting as you can only improve reload on the masterwork which is a 1 out of 5 chance and only gets the gun to barely 50 reload. Even then the purpose of Voltshot is add clear, which the weapon is already incredible at, so there really isn’t any point in going for that. Blast Radius only affects the initial explosion before the wave goes out, so the value of that stat is overhyped on this weapon. Handling is really the true giga-stat for Hullabaloo when paired with Autoloader or Envious Assassin." Masterwork: Handling, Blast Radius, Velocity 
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3300816228,2396489472

title:S23 Wish Craftable Weapons
description:The Origin trait here is called Dragon’s Vengeance, and it is mostly forgettable. It’s a decent effect, but you shouldn’t be actively seeking to activate it, so it is just a fun little surprise when it triggers.

// Supercluster ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "Another good seasonal weapon. With Reconstruction and Surrounded in tow, the only thing holding this back from being a top-tier weapon is the archetype and the element. Being strand instead of kinetic leaves damage on the table, and slugs just aren’t very good right now. If/when slugs get a buff this weapon will benefit enormously." Masterwork: Handling 
dimwishlist:item=92459755&perks=1840239774,791862061,1523832109,3708227201


// Subjunctive (god-pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks first choice "Perks are middle of the road, and nothing stands out for PvP. In PvE this is a pretty boring rehash of other weapons we’ve already had. Overall it’s not terrible, but it does not stand out. It does have Shoot to Loot, but I’m not sure that is enough to justify using this over superior weapons. With all the nerfs that IKELOS_SMG has taken over the years this may finally be enough to dethrone it?" Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=1447836603&perks=4090651448,3230963543,4071163871,2173046394


// Subjunctive (pve)

It does have Shoot to Loot, but I’m not sure that is enough to justify using this over superior weapons. // Scatter Signal (god-pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks first choice "Stats are great for the archetype, even though this isn’t the best archetype in PvP right now. Under-Over is a sleeper perk for PvP here that allows you to burst through woven mail and overshield (which includes warlocks in rifts!). For PvE however this is a pretty interesting weapon. Overflow+Controlled Burst is a legit combo that should be great for bursting down majors, whereas there is a lot of interesting utility in the new Slice, Deconstruct, and Attrition Orbs perks." Masterwork: Charge Time tags:god-pve
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=202670084,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626


// Scatter Signal (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Perks first choice "Stats are great for the archetype, even though this isn’t the best archetype in PvP right now. Under-Over is a sleeper perk for PvP here that allows you to burst through woven mail and overshield (which includes warlocks in rifts!). For PvE however this is a pretty interesting weapon. Overflow+Controlled Burst is a legit combo that should be great for bursting down majors, whereas there is a lot of interesting utility in the new Slice, Deconstruct, and Attrition Orbs perks." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=202670084,2969185026,1428297954,1870851715


// Scatter Signal (pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks "Stats are great for the archetype, even though this isn’t the best archetype in PvP right now. Under-Over is a sleeper perk for PvP here that allows you to burst through woven mail and overshield (which includes warlocks in rifts!). For PvE however this is a pretty interesting weapon. Overflow+Controlled Burst is a legit combo that should be great for bursting down majors, whereas there is a lot of interesting utility in the new Slice, Deconstruct, and Attrition Orbs perks." Masterwork: Charge Time tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=202670084,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=202670084,2680121939,923806249,2594592626

title:S23 Random Roll Weapons
description:The Wild Card origin trait has a chance to drop a few orange telesto balls on the ground. It’s pretty cool, not sure how great it is in total, but hey, free damage and area control isn’t anything to sneeze at.

// Breakneck (god-pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Recommended Perks first choice "An old favorite brought back. I hope that Onslaught is actually a damage increase now, so I’m evaluating it with that assumption in mind. Shoot to Loot+Kinetic Tremors is an awesome PvE combo, and should feel great. Onslaught might be decent, but I doubt it’ll be tremendous in highend content. For PvP, if Onslaught raises the TTK then this could be a decent chaining auto." Masterwork: Reload tags:god-pve

// Lethal Abundance ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "This is one of the best weapons we’re getting this season. Slice and Onslaught both look very strong in all content and should be a powerhouse pairing. For PvP Slice is the unique effect here that acts as a reverse 15% buff on-demand. This archetype is lacking in PvP, but this is an interesting enough effect that it warrants discussion." Masterwork: Reload

// Lethal Abundance (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Perks first choice "This is one of the best weapons we’re getting this season. Slice and Onslaught both look very strong in all content and should be a powerhouse pairing. For PvP Slice is the unique effect here that acts as a reverse 15% buff on-demand. This archetype is lacking in PvP, but this is an interesting enough effect that it warrants discussion." Masterwork: Range tags:god-pvp

// Belisarius-D (god-pvp)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvP Recommended Rolls first choice "PvP only, but what did you expect? It should be a solid weapon, but this archetype really doesn’t see much play. Slice, however, is a 15% debuff for your opponent in PvP and acts as basically a reverse Golden Tricorn effect which should help you win gunfights that you wouldn’t normally. This is very interesting." Masterwork: Range, Stability tags:god-pvp
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=839105230,1885400500,923806249,460017080,1067908860

dimwishlist:item=4248997900&perks=1482024992,2749775325,923806249,243981275
dimwishlist:item=4248997900&perks=1482024992,2680121939,923806249,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4248997900&perks=1482024992,2680121939,923806249,365154968
dimwishlist:item=4248997900&perks=1482024992,2680121939,923806249,243981275


title:Dawning 2023 Weapons
description:The Origin trait for these weapons just grants you a dawning gift. This leaves a small purple cube on the ground that heals you and restores energy when picked up. It’s basically a Wellspring proc combined with a Recuperation proc. In general, that is pretty nice, and you don’t really need to think about it. Most of these weapons have multiple origin traits so you can switch over to Hakke, Suros, or Omolon as well.

// Stay Frosty - Recommended Perks ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "This is one of my favorite archetypes, but the muzzle flash on this gun makes it borderline unusable. I’m not sure Bungie will ever fix it as it has had this problem for a long time now and they have not addressed it. The stats on this are very comparable to others, so it doesn’t need a ton of help anywhere, just good stat bumps where you want it. For PvP you want Arrowhead Brake+Counterbalance mod to get to 100 recoil. A lightweight frame with Headstone and Desperado is really cool in PvE, and all you “need” beyond that is Arrowhead Brake so you can actually hit those crits reliably. But again, with that horrible muzzle flash effect taking up the entire screen I can’t in good conscience recommend this gun." Masterwork: Stability, Range
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,1885400500,588594999,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,1885400500,588594999,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,1885400500,2450788523,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,1885400500,2450788523,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,3177308360,588594999,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,3177308360,588594999,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,3177308360,2450788523,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,3177308360,2450788523,460017080


// Stay Frosty - PvE Perks (pve)
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) PvE Perks "This is one of my favorite archetypes, but the muzzle flash on this gun makes it borderline unusable. I’m not sure Bungie will ever fix it as it has had this problem for a long time now and they have not addressed it. The stats on this are very comparable to others, so it doesn’t need a ton of help anywhere, just good stat bumps where you want it. For PvP you want Arrowhead Brake+Counterbalance mod to get to 100 recoil. A lightweight frame with Headstone and Desperado is really cool in PvE, and all you “need” beyond that is Arrowhead Brake so you can actually hit those crits reliably. But again, with that horrible muzzle flash effect taking up the entire screen I can’t in good conscience recommend this gun." Masterwork: Reload tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=1891321753&perks=839105230,1885400500,3828510309,124408337

// Zephyr - Recommended Perks first choice
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "Cold Steel is very unique to this weapon and still very good. The origin trait here is also not irrelevant, so if you got a more standard Relentless+Whirlwind roll on this then that would be a top-of-the-heap adaptive sword. This is the weapon I’m personally grinding for. The Origin Trait is fantastic on this sword since you won’t even notice picking it up and you’ll just be healing and getting energy for free. Worth calling out that the pairing of Turnabout with the origin trait makes for a surprising amount of tankiness in the right situations." Masterwork: Impact
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130


// Zephyr - Recommended Perks ()
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks "Cold Steel is very unique to this weapon and still very good. The origin trait here is also not irrelevant, so if you got a more standard Relentless+Whirlwind roll on this then that would be a top-of-the-heap adaptive sword. This is the weapon I’m personally grinding for. The Origin Trait is fantastic on this sword since you won’t even notice picking it up and you’ll just be healing and getting energy for free. Worth calling out that the pairing of Turnabout with the origin trait makes for a surprising amount of tankiness in the right situations." Masterwork: Impact

// Albedo Wing - Recommended Perks first choice 
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "This is fine. Nothing too special, but it is the first aggressive glaive for arc that we have, so there is at least something cooking here. Again, this isn’t craftable nor can it take adept mods so good luck getting a usable one. If you do land a solid roll it should be a decent weapon. Beacon Rounds is a trap on glaives." Masterwork: Shield Duration

High-Impact fusions aren’t the best for either PvP or PvE and this can’t get adept mods nor enhanced perks. If you do happen to get a good roll here then it will be quite serviceable as a fusion for void builds until we get Zealot’s Reward’s reissue someday." Masterwork: Charge Time

This weapon needs so much help getting to a base level of usability that it hardly seems worth it compared to so many other SMGs that don’t need so much help. In PvE there just isn’t a good reason to justify using this." Masterwork: Reload

// Avalanche - Recommended Perks first choice 
//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c) Recommended Perks first choice "Avalanche is back again, and similar to Stay Frosty it also has a bizarre disqualifying characteristic. This gun has extremely low total ammo inventory, and once again Bungie simply just hasn’t fixed this, so it really isn’t worth using at all. It’s best roll is the same roll as Unwavering Impact which is better than this gun in every way - as well as not being tied to a time-locked event." Masterwork: Handling
